name: Pax
short: Pax is an extremely lightweight Spacebar client designed to work on old browsers and controlled environments
description: Pax is an extremely lightweight Spacebar client designed to work on old browsers and controlled environments. It's currently in development, born in November 2025, and takes the form of a single HTML file of ~180 Ko that can be locally stored anywhere and opened in a browser without any hosting setup. This also allows Pax to bypass parental controls such as Google Family Link.

1.1.6.changelog:
1.1.6 "nice stuff again" release on 15/12/25

- Pax is under GNU General Public License v3.0 now
- added unread channels and guilds
- changed some toki pona

- fixed toki pona disappearing in the emojiSearch input
- fixed user typing system
- context menu's default behavior on the message bar is not prevented anymore

- sending multi-line messages is now possible by using \n
    - pasting multi-line text should convert line breaks into \n too
    - message edit input supports that too
    - I forgot that in the previous update you could use it in bio's
- message edit input is now larger
    - you can switch the message your currently editing more easily too
